name: inky
description: An editor for ink: inkle's narrative scripting language

releases.name: Version 0.7.0 - Lists!
releases.body:
This version brings support for a **brand new powerful ink feature - Lists** - see [the documentation](https://github.com/inkle/ink/blob/master/Documentation/WritingWithInk.md#part-5-advanced-state-tracking).

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/858967/21818200/d126b336-d75e-11e6-8b81-8a0d15abdcbd.png)

**WARNING**: This version temporarily breaks Export for Web functionality, until [inkjs](http://www.github.com/y-lohse/inkjs) catches up with the lists support, which is a large new feature. If you don't need lists, please continue to use [inky version 0.6.4](https://github.com/inkle/inky/releases/tag/0.6.4).

releases.name: Version 0.6.4
releases.body:
- Update to ink 0.6.4, which brings an optimisation for when you do a long calculation after a line of content, and forces choices to always come after content, even if you do sneaky things with threads that would otherwise cause them to be interleaved.
- Fix for syntax highlighting TODOs.

releases.name: Version 0.6.3
releases.body: Update to ink version 0.6.3 (and inkjs version 1.4.3), which brings a few bug fixes, including mismatched left/right glue, crashing when using tags in choices, comparisons of divert target with other expression types, and `-> END` not properly ending in some cases.

releases.name: Version 0.6.2
releases.body:
- Update ink to 0.6.2 - more fixes for locales that use `,` as decimal point so that floats get serialised correctly.
- Update inkjs to 1.4.2

releases.name: Version 0.6.1
releases.body: Update to inkjs that includes some bug fixes (affects export to web).

releases.name: Version 0.6.0
releases.body:
- This update brings all the improves to ink that came in versions [0.6.0](https://github.com/inkle/ink/releases/tag/0.6.0) and [0.6.1](https://github.com/inkle/ink/releases/tag/0.6.1).
- The biggest new feature is that the tags feature that came in ink 0.6.0 is now supported in Inky, and you have the option to toggle their visibility via the _Story â†’ Tags Visible_ menu.
- Note that Electron and the use of the electron-packager (the tech that Inky is built on) have been updated for this release. Let us know if you have any issues, particularly on Windows and Linux, which have been given less testing.

releases.name: Version 0.5.1
releases.body:
This version simply restores _Export for web_ functionality by including the latest version of inkjs.

And from version 0.5.0:
- Expression watching now available! Add a little snippet of ink in order to track variable changes.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/858967/18673172/adc0dd64-7f42-11e6-882b-030bc481f3c9.png)
- Fix for inky getting locked up when opening files (ouch)
- Fix for inky wiping out new include files just after you've created them
- Fix for instances of inklecate being left running
- Warning before reloading the window (web view)
- Reorganised the app's menus a bit

Includes Ink version 0.5.1:
- When diverting to specific knots repeatedly from game code, the visit count now gets updated correctly, so long as your knot has fully completed with an `-> END`. If it hasn't, you can also now call `myStory.state.ForceEnd()` to mark the flow complete. Thanks for the report @AdamNashGames!
- A call to `-> DONE` now ensures that flow actually stops, rather than marking it "safe to exit". (oops!)
- `RANDOM(min, max)` and `SEED_RANDOM(intSeed)` now available! Random's min and max bounds are inclusive, e.g. `I rolled a {RANDOM(1,6)}.`.
- Warning for using `else:` rather than `- else:`.
- Show error when passing `-> myVar` as a divert target rather than just `myVar`. (Slightly confusing)

releases.name: Version 0.5
releases.body:
**WARNING**: This version breaks _Export for web_ functionality, since the version of ink is currently newer than is supported by inkjs. We'll update inky again as soon as compatibility is restored.
- Expression watching now available! Add a little snippet of ink in order to track variable changes.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/858967/18673172/adc0dd64-7f42-11e6-882b-030bc481f3c9.png)
- Fix for inky getting locked up when opening files (ouch)
- Fix for inky wiping out new include files just after you've created them
- Fix for instances of inklecate being left running
- Warning before reloading the window (web view)
- Reorganised the app's menus a bit

Includes Ink version 0.5.1:
- When diverting to specific knots repeatedly from game code, the visit count now gets updated correctly, so long as your knot has fully completed with an `-> END`. If it hasn't, you can also now call `myStory.state.ForceEnd()` to mark the flow complete. Thanks for the report @AdamNashGames!
- A call to `-> DONE` now ensures that flow actually stops, rather than marking it "safe to exit". (oops!)
- `RANDOM(min, max)` and `SEED_RANDOM(intSeed)` now available! Random's min and max bounds are inclusive, e.g. `I rolled a {RANDOM(1,6)}.`.
- Warning for using `else:` rather than `- else:`.
- Show error when passing `-> myVar` as a divert target rather than just `myVar`. (Slightly confusing)

releases.name: Version 0.4.1
releases.body:
- Latest version of ink/inklecate (0.5), with bug fixes, including one for #167)
- Syntax highlighting: `EXTERNAL` lines now recognised, and slight improvements for sequences and conditionals
- Fix for web template scrolling on Firefox (thanks @NihilAleph)

releases.name: Version 0.4.0
releases.body:
- "Find" functionality restored - available on CMD-F (Mac) / CTRL-F (Windows).
- Documentation integrated directly into Inky - available at Help -> Show Documentation. Thanks @Julisep!
- Build now available for Windows 32 bit
- Fix for Export for Web when your root in file is called main.ink (was colliding with our template's main.js)
- Small fix for temporary build folder on Ubuntu
- Latest [ink fixes](https://github.com/inkle/ink/releases/tag/0.4.1): fix for using `temp` variables in options, and for save/load before `Continue` is called for the first time.

releases.name: Version 0.3.1
releases.body:
Export for web now uses [inkjs](www.github.com/y-lohse/inkjs) 1.1.0, which works on browsers that aren't super-modern, and also mobile browsers.

From 0.3:
- First version of Export for web added

From 0.2.2:
- More subtle updating of player view so it doesn't continually refresh and scroll, and tries to update more discreetly. (by double-buffering the view and having it fade/scroll only when it needs to)
- Made Step Back button more response by having it immediately update view, before the model has finished re-playing the story

From 0.2.1:
-  Ability to alt-click content in the player view in order to jump to where that text was defined (file and line number) in the editor. Works for content, not choices, for now.

releases.name: Version 0.3
releases.body:
Version 0.3 brings an **Export for Web** option, taking advantage of [inkjs](https://github.com/y-lohse/inkjs), the excellent JavaScript port of ink, allowing you to quickly and easily share your ink stories online in a minimal web player.

**Warning:** The Export of web feature is still experimental, and only works in the most modern of browsers (e.g. latest Chrome). It doesn't work on mobile Safari right now.

From 0.2.2:
- More subtle updating of player view so it doesn't continually refresh and scroll, and tries to update more discreetly. (by double-buffering the view and having it fade/scroll only when it needs to)
- Made Step Back button more response by having it immediately update view, before the model has finished re-playing the story

From 0.2.1:
-  Ability to alt-click content in the player view in order to jump to where that text was defined (file and line number) in the editor. Works for content, not choices, for now.

- More subtle updating of player view so it doesn't continually refresh and scroll, and tries to update more discreetly. (by double-buffering the view and having it fade/scroll only when it needs to)
- Made Step Back button more response by having it immediately update view, before the model has finished re-playing the story

And from 0.2.1:
-  Ability to alt-click content in the player view in order to jump to where that text was defined (file and line number) in the editor. Works for content, not choices, for now.

releases.name: New feature
releases.body: New feature: Ability to alt-click content in the player view in order to jump to where that text was defined (file and line number) in the editor. Works for content, not choices, for now.

releases.name: 0.2.0 - Windows now available
releases.body:
Windows version is "even more alpha" than the Mac version, since it's even less tested! Let us know if you see any bugs, or whether there's any core/standard Windows functionality that you feel is missing.

A few fixes are also in this version.
